intro: Telipogon ionopogon, commonly known as the golden spike-rush, is a rare and distinctive member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its dense, spike-like inflorescences that are typically golden in color. Native to the southern United States, it thrives in wetland environments such as marshes and swamps. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
